channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large amount of flytipped rubbish on calypso crescent, 10th July
item.description:
Hi there, a large amount of rubbish has been flytipped on calypso crescent. This was left overnight yesterday. This area is often used to fly tip rubbish. It would be great if this could be cleared away. Thank you.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipping dumping by St. Marks Church St Marks Rise., 10th July
item.description:
Fly Tipping dumping by St. Marks Church St Marks Rise.

item.title: A repeat offence by leaving bags of rubbish Hurstwood Av, 10th July
item.description:
This spot has been reported numerous times. The area requires CCTV to catch the offender and a bin to educate the repeat offenders. This is a route to school and children are shown an example that this is acceptable behaviour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hurstwood Avenue, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Orange graffiti sprayed on BT Openreach box 10, 10th July
item.description:
Overnight at 0330 lads sprayed orange graffiti on the side and top of BT Openreach Box 10 outside 1 Macarthar Terrace, Charlton Park Road by the junction with Fairfield Grove. Please can this be reported to police as criminal damage, and then removed with BT recharged. With good intelligence work, police should be able to trace the tag and culprits.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Park Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Next to lamp post outside Victoria House and opposite Bristol House, 10th July
item.description:
The manhole has been loose for a few days and disturbs residents opposite at night. It's also loud during the day,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37-63, Southampton Row, Bloomsbury, London

item.title: Poles, 10th July
item.description:
Hi the poles put in by the football club to section off the rec are falling down. Some are flat on floor but others at an angle the makes it easy for a dog to run in and injure themselves. The rope can't be seen either so kids can cycle into it . Please remove all poles and the blue rope

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Mead Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken car part/FLYTIP, 10th July
item.description:
On the road between Bramley Place and Crayford way on the corner next to the mini roundabout. It cannot be missed. Been here for about 2 weeks now so whoever is sweeping Maiden Lane is missing this. Please remove the flytip and litter from this footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maiden Lane, Barnes Cray, London

item.title: Fly tipping outside bin store on Glebe Road, 10th July
item.description:
Significant amount of residential waste sacks piling up outside bin store on Glebe Road. Very unhygienic in hot weather and something I have reported multiple times over past year. The bins have not been collected which is why people are now piling them up

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Middleton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
